Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff home run in the first inning
Mark Vientos hit a solo home run in the first inning to tie the game
Tommy Edman stroked an RBI double in the third inning
Enrique Hernandez's ensuing infield single gave the Dodgers a 3-1 lead
Mookie Betts homered against Phil Maton in the sixth inning to bury the Mets in a 7-2 hole
Edman's two-run double in the eighth and Will Smith's RBI single buried the Mets in a 10-2 hole
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso said, 'I believe in this group … the character of this team. The one word I can think of for the 2024 Mets, other than ‘Grimace,’ is ‘resiliency.’ That’s just who we are. We have fun, we enjoy the moment, but at the end of day we’re a resilient bunch and we respond in a very positive way.'
Brandon Nimmo said, 'We have put pressure on them — I would take that first game out of it. We just haven’t gotten that big hit.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets finished 0-for-10 with runners in scoring position in the game
In the four games, they are 4-for-29 (.138) in that category. The Dodgers have outscored the Mets, 30-9, in the series
Others: Jose Quintana lasted only 3 ¹/₃ innings and allowed five earned runs on five hits with four walks and two strikeouts
Luis Severino's start of only 4 ²/₃ innings a night earlier
Carlos Mendoza, the manager, emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
